Note: Date and publisher written in pencil on poster. Orientation:  Vertical.
Description: Text says that people can choose to work for America freely and for pay or be forced to work without pay if the war is lost. There are two small illustrations, a peaceful industrial scene with a banner labeled "American Industry" and another depicting Germans holding guns over laborers, labeled "Prussianized Industry."
Digital Collection: Allied Posters of World War I
Local Rights Statement: This material is made available for private study, scholarship, and research use. For access to the original or a high resolution reproduction, contact: Temple University Libraries, Special Collections Research Center, scrc@temple.edu, 215-204-8257.

Title: Paid labor-or-forced labor : which?
